abstract.text: A utility object for initiating map-based searches and processing the results.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object to execute a single search request. You might use this class to search for addresses or points of interest on the map. Upon completion of the request, the object delivers the results to the completion handler that you provide.

abstract.text: Display map or satellite imagery within your app, call out points of interest, and determine placemark information for map coordinates.
An object that filters which address options to include or exclude in search results.
A structure that contains options for filtering results in a search.
A structured request to use when searching for points of interest.
A utility object for initiating map-based searches and processing the results.
A completion handler block for a search operation.
The parameters to use when searching for points of interest on the map.
The results from a map-based search.
Options that indicate types of search results.
Cancels an in-progress search operation.
Creates and returns a search object with the specified parameters.
Creates and returns a search object for fetching points of interest.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the search is in progress.
Starts the search and delivers the results to the specified completion handler.
A utility object for generating a list of completion strings based on a partial search string that you provide.
Options that indicate types of search completions.
A fully formed string that completes a partial string.
A value that indicates the importance of the configured region.
Provide automatic search completions for a partial search query, search the map for relevant locations nearby, and retrieve details for selected points of interest.

doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/Map.title: Interacting with nearby points of interest

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
